front.title: The Grant Negotiation and Authorization Protocol

abstract.t: Client software often desires resources or identity claims that are independent of the client. This protocol allows a user and/or resource owner to delegate resource authorization and/or release of identity claims to a server. Client software can then request access to resources and/or identity claims by calling the server. The server acquires consent and authorization from the user and/or resource owner if required, and then returns to the client software the authorization and identity claims that were approved. This protocol may be extended to support alternative authorizations, claims, interactions, and client authentication mechanisms.
